Interface AudioSource

    Status indicates the current status of the audio source.

  • Method Details

    • setChannel

      void setChannel(int channel)
      Do not use.
      Parameters:
      channel - the desired channel index, or -1 if stopped

    • getChannel

      int getChannel()
      Do not use.
      Returns:
      the channel index, or -1 if stopped

    • getDryFilter

      Filter getDryFilter()
      Returns:
      The {#link Filter dry filter} that is set.
      See Also:
      • AudioNode.setDryFilter(com.jme3.audio.Filter)

    • getAudioData

      AudioData getAudioData()
      Returns:
      The AudioData set previously with AudioNode.setAudioData(com.jme3.audio.AudioData, com.jme3.audio.AudioKey) or any of the constructors that initialize the audio data.

    • setStatus

      void setStatus(AudioSource.Status status)
      Do not use.
      Parameters:
      status - the desired Status

    • getStatus

      AudioSource.Status getStatus()
      Returns:
      The AudioSource.Status of the audio source. The status will be changed when either the AudioNode.play() or AudioNode.stop() methods are called.

    • isLooping

      boolean isLooping()
      Returns:
      True if the audio will keep looping after it is done playing, otherwise, false.
      See Also:
      • AudioNode.setLooping(boolean)

    • getPitch

      float getPitch()
      Returns:
      The pitch of the audio, also the speed of playback.
      See Also:
      • AudioNode.setPitch(float)

    • getVolume

      float getVolume()
      Returns:
      The volume of this audio source.
      See Also:
      • AudioNode.setVolume(float)

    • getTimeOffset

      float getTimeOffset()
      Returns:
      the time offset in the sound sample to start playing

    • getPlaybackTime

      float getPlaybackTime()
      Returns:
      the current playback position of the source in seconds.

    • getPosition

      Vector3f getPosition()
      Returns:
      The position of the audio source.

    • getVelocity

      Vector3f getVelocity()
      Returns:
      The velocity of the audio source.
      See Also:
      • AudioNode.setVelocity(com.jme3.math.Vector3f)

    • isReverbEnabled

      boolean isReverbEnabled()
      Returns:
      True if reverb is enabled, otherwise false.
      See Also:
      • AudioNode.setReverbEnabled(boolean)

    • getReverbFilter

      Filter getReverbFilter()
      Returns:
      Filter for the reverberations of this audio source.
      See Also:
      • AudioNode.setReverbFilter(com.jme3.audio.Filter)

    • getMaxDistance

      float getMaxDistance()
      Returns:
      Maximum distance for this audio source.
      See Also:
      • AudioNode.setMaxDistance(float)

    • getRefDistance

      float getRefDistance()
      Returns:
      The reference playing distance for the audio source.
      See Also:
      • AudioNode.setRefDistance(float)

    • isDirectional

      boolean isDirectional()
      Returns:
      True if the audio source is directional
      See Also:
      • AudioNode.setDirectional(boolean)

    • getDirection

      Vector3f getDirection()
      Returns:
      The direction of this audio source.
      See Also:
      • AudioNode.setDirection(com.jme3.math.Vector3f)

    • getInnerAngle

      float getInnerAngle()
      Returns:
      The directional audio source, cone inner angle.
      See Also:
      • AudioNode.setInnerAngle(float)

    • getOuterAngle

      float getOuterAngle()
      Returns:
      The directional audio source, cone outer angle.
      See Also:
      • AudioNode.setOuterAngle(float)

    • isPositional

      boolean isPositional()
      Returns:
      True if the audio source is positional.
      See Also:
      • AudioNode.setPositional(boolean)
